#### [**Dr. Rebecca Dikow**](rebecca/index.qmd) |  [{{< ai orcid >}}](https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9668-3683) [{{< ai google-scholar >}}](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=gBRB_OkAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao) [{{< ai cv >}}]() [{{< fa brands github >}}](https://github.com/rdikow) [{{< fa envelope >}}](mailto:dikowr@si.edu)  
<br/>
Rebecca Dikow is a Research Data Scientist and leads the Smithsonian Institution Data Science Lab. She is working with Smithsonian scientists to conduct biodiversity research, including genomics, informatics, and machine learning. She is an affiliated faculty member in the George Mason University School of Systems Biology.
:::

#### [**Mike Trizna**](mike/index.qmd) |  [{{< ai orcid >}}](https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0537-8382) [{{< ai google-scholar >}}](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=dBG05GYAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=sra) [{{< ai cv >}}]() [{{< fa brands github >}}](https://github.com/miketrizna) [{{< fa envelope >}}](mailto:triznam@si.edu)
<br/>
Mike Trizna is a Research Data Scientist with an expertise in bioinformatics and machine learning. Mike works with Smithsonian partners on machine learning and visualization projects and leads the Smithsonian's partnership with the [Carpentries](https://carpentries.org/) (formerly Software Carpentry and Data Carpentry).

#### [**Dr. Alex White**](alex/index.qmd) |  [{{< ai orcid >}}](https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9708-2406) [{{< ai google-scholar >}}](https://scholar.google.dk/citations?user=YkggDqgAAAAJ&hl=en) [{{< ai cv >}}]() [{{< fa brands github >}}](https://github.com/aewhite100) [{{< fa envelope >}}](mailto:whiteae@si.edu)
<br/>
Alex White is a Biodiversity Research Data Scientist with expertise in biogeography, quantitative ecology, ornithology, and community phylogenetics. Alex leads projects that leverage digitized museum collections as well as applications of machine learning in field studies of animal and plant ecology. He is an Associate Editor for Ornithology.
